resource_dependency.wheel_spin_api: POST /api/spin - Processes a wheel spin and returns the prize won.
resource_dependency.prize_list_api: GET /api/prizes - Returns a list of available prizes.
resource_dependency.winning_history_api: GET /api/history - Returns the current user's winning history.
resource_dependency.user_identification_mechanism: Session-based authentication using cookies or localStorage token for identifying users.
resource_dependency.wheel_component_library: A third-party or custom-built spinning wheel library with animation support.

function: Allow users to spin a virtual wheel of fortune to win prizes and see results immediately.
static_description: The main landing area features a large circular wheel centered on screen, visually divided into colored segments representing different prizes. Below the wheel is a prominent 'Spin' button styled in dark red (#8B0000) against a light gray (#D3D3D3) background. Above the wheel, there’s a title reading 'Spin to Win!' aligned center.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Spin' button triggers the spinning animation. The button becomes disabled until the spin completes.
Upon completion, the wheel stops at a random segment, highlighting the winning prize. A modal appears displaying the prize name and message such as 'Congratulations! You've won [Prize Name]'.

resource_dependency.prize_list_api: GET /api/prizes - Returns a list of available prizes.

function: Display all available prizes that can be won through the wheel of fortune game.
static_description: Below or beside the wheel section, a dedicated 'Prize List' section shows all available prizes in a responsive grid or table layout. Each item includes an image thumbnail, prize name, and probability percentage. Background color is light gray (#D3D3D3), and headers and borders use dark red (#8B0000).

resource_dependency.winning_history_api: GET /api/history - Returns the current user's winning history.

function: Show a logged-in user’s past winning records from previous spins.
static_description: Located beneath the main sections, this displays a scrollable table titled 'My Winnings'. Columns include Date & Time, Prize Won, and Status (claimed/unclaimed). Rows alternate between white and light gray backgrounds, while headers are styled with dark red (#8B0000) text and background.

resource_dependency.authentication_header: Authorization Bearer Token or session cookie used for tracking user identity across requests.

function: Ensure all dynamic content like prizes, user history, and spin outcomes are fetched from backend services via RESTful APIs.
static_description: All dynamic data sections (Wheel Interface, Prize List, Winning Records) initially show loading indicators before populating content fetched asynchronously from the defined endpoints.

resource_dependency.database_connection_config: Connects to PostgreSQL instance using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.
resource_dependency.pg_client_library: Uses node-postgres (pg) package or similar to connect and query the database.

function: Establish secure connection to PostgreSQL database using provided credentials and enable querying capabilities.
static_description: Not visible in UI but enables backend server to execute queries against the configured PostgreSQL instance.

resource_dependency.prizes_table_schema: Table: prizes(id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), description TEXT, image_url TEXT, probability DECIMAL)
resource_dependency.user_winnings_table_schema: Table: winnings(id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, user_identifier TEXT, prize_id INTEGER REFERENCES prizes(id), timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)

function: Define database structure to store prize information and track each user's winning record.
static_description: Schema-only definition ensuring future compatibility with application logic for storing and retrieving prize and user data.

resource_dependency.spin_result_endpoint: POST /api/spin - Accepts request and inserts result into the 'winnings' table with user identifier and selected prize ID.
resource_dependency.user_identification_field: User identified either by session ID or client-generated UUID stored in browser storage.

function: Record every successful spin outcome along with associated user into the database.
static_description: Not directly visible in UI but supports backend operation when POST /api/spin is called.

resource_dependency.spinning_wheel_animation: CSS transitions or JavaScript-based animation simulating realistic rotation deceleration.

function: Provide engaging visual and auditory feedback during the wheel spinning process.
static_description: While spinning, the wheel rotates smoothly with gradually decreasing speed accompanied by optional sound effect. Visual cues indicate ongoing activity.

function: Ensure consistent styling and adaptability across various device sizes using light gray background and dark red accents.
static_description: Entire website uses light gray (#D3D3D3) background throughout pages. All interactive elements, headers, and highlights utilize dark red (#8B0000). Layout adjusts gracefully from desktop to mobile views using media queries.

resource_dependency.landing_page_content: Welcome paragraph explaining how to play, followed by navigation links to start playing or view prizes/winnings.

function: Introduce visitors to the concept and mechanics of the wheel of fortune game.
static_description: Top section contains welcoming headline ('Try Your Luck Today!'), short instructional paragraph, hero image of the wheel, and call-to-action buttons such as 'Start Playing' and 'View Prizes', styled with dark red buttons over light gray background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Start Playing' scrolls down to the wheel interface. Clicking 'View Prizes' navigates to or reveals the prize listing section.

resource_dependency.login_endpoint_stub: Optional stubbed login/signup form if needed later.

function: Identify returning users without requiring full registration/login flow.
static_description: No explicit UI element unless extended beyond MVP scope; relies on local/session storage or simple cookie mechanism to persist user ID across visits.

resource_dependency.auth_header_required: Endpoint requires authenticated user context to filter relevant records.

function: Expose an endpoint allowing frontend to retrieve historical wins tied to the current user.
static_description: Returns JSON array of past spins including timestamps and prize references.

function: Serve list of all available prizes to populate frontend components.
static_description: Returns complete dataset of active prizes formatted as JSON array.

resource_dependency.response_format: { success: true, prizeId: number, prizeName: string }

function: Process incoming spin requests, determine outcome, save result, and respond with prize details.
static_description: Handles business logic of selecting a prize based on probabilities and saving the event.

resource_dependency.scripts_in_package_json: "install:all": "concurrently \"npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"npm run dev:frontend\" \"npm run dev:backend\""

function: Configure development workflow to manage both frontend and backend installation/startup simultaneously.
static_description: Defined within root package.json file enabling unified setup and launch commands.
